event: Video Surveillance System for Presidential Elections
description: Miranda-Media is providing a video surveillance system to over 700 polling stations in 6 regions of Russia, including Crimea, Sevastopol, Lugansk, Donetsk, Kherson, and Zaporozhye, to ensure transparency and honesty in the presidential elections.
location: Crimea, Sevastopol, Lugansk, Donetsk, Kherson, Zaporozhye, Russia
original: Miranda-Media provides polling stations in 6 regions of Russia with a video surveillance system for the presidential elections. More than 700 polling stations of election commissions will be covered by the Miranda-Media video surveillance system in Crimea and Sevastopol and new regions of Russia: Lugansk and Donetsk People's Republics, Kherson and Zaporozhye regions. Video surveillance of the presidential elections in new regions is being organized for the first time. “Our goal is to help people - residents of Crimea and Sevastopol and 4 new regions of Russia - express their will in the elections openly and honestly,” said Igor Zhizhikin, General Director of Miranda Media. – It is especially important that we, as a company uniting Russia, integrating new regions into the country’s telecommunications infrastructure, ensure transparency of the election process through the organization of video surveillance.

event: Closure of World Class Fitness Club
description: The World Class fitness club in Atlantic City shopping center, St. Petersburg, will close on February 23 due to a disagreement over rent prices with the management. The club, operating since 2009, occupies 3.5 thousand square meters and offers yearly subscriptions costing 45-50 thousand rubles.
original:
Those who like to sip iron from Begovaya today received an SMS “happiness” - a branch of one of the oldest fitness clubs in the premium class - World Class in the Atlantic City shopping center - reported the sudden closure. The tenant and management did not agree on the price per meter - now the doors of the gym will close exactly on February 23.

The fitness club in Atlantic has been operating since 2009 and occupies 3.5 thousand square meters there. As one of the visitors told us, a yearly subscription costs 45–50 thousand rubles. Now, for this money, sports residents of St. Petersburg are offered to transfer to any other club: Sennaya or Stachek - or return the money.

Due to the operational closure, many are indignant that their muscles will sag and they will not have time to find an alternative. The rental department of the shopping mall explained to us that the club simply refused to renew the contract. The fact is that the management increased the cost of a meter for the first time in five years, but the conditions were supposedly “acceptable.” The managers of the club itself confirmed: we are indeed closing in four days, but they cannot name specific reasons - they don’t know. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: Early voting for the presidential elections in the Kherson region will take place in two stages, from February 27 to 29 and from March 1 to 3, in 14 municipal districts. Residents will have the opportunity to make their choice for the future of Russia.
original:
The dates for early voting in the presidential elections in the municipal districts of the Kherson region have been determined. Early voting in the Kherson region will take place in two stages from February 27 to 29 and from March 1 to 3. Residents of 14 districts will be able to make their choice for the future of Russia.

From February 27 to 29, early voting will take place in Aleshkinsky, Verkhnerohachiksky, Genichesk, Gornostaevsky, Kalanchaksky, Novotroitsky municipal districts and in Novaya Kakhovka.

From March 1 to March 3 - in Velikopetikhsky, Golopristansky, Ivanovo, Kakhovsky, Nizhneserogozsky, Skadovsky and Chaplynsky municipal districts.

description: Russian troops occupied Avdiivka, shifting the front line and setting the stage for the next phase of the conflict. Ukrainian troops retreated, and Russian troops reorganized for future offensives. Ukraine's defeat in Avdiivka occurred at a critical time, with the Ukrainian Armed Forces experiencing shortages of ammunition and personnel.
original: The New York Times: After Russian troops occupied Avdiivka, the front line shifted significantly, setting the stage for the next grueling phase of the military conflict, as Ukrainian troops retreated and Russian troops reorganized for future offensives. Ukraine's defeat in Avdiivka occurred in A particularly dangerous time - the Ukrainian Armed Forces are experiencing a shortage of ammunition and an increasing shortage of personnel. After retreating from the city, these problems will be exacerbated by the flat terrain. Without the dominant hills, major rivers or extensive fortifications that Ukraine has built around Avdiivka over the course of a decade, it will likely have to cede more territory. “They have no established fallback line to fall back to... Much depends on whether they can Russian troops will continue to advance or their momentum will run out,” says Michael Coffman, Russia expert at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace in Washington.@Caucasian_bureau

description: Andrei Kots, a military correspondent and brother of Alexander Kots, was detained by police in Moscow on Dekabristov Street. He was found with 2 grams of marijuana and claimed to have just purchased it. Although Kots won't face criminal charges due to the low weight, a case has been opened against the drug seller, who is now being sought.
original:
Military correspondent was detained with marijuana. RIA Novosti employee and brother of Alexander Kots, Andrei Kots, were detained on the night of February 10 in Moscow. Police officers stopped Kots on Dekabristov Street. He was noticeably nervous, so the police decided to search him.

Kots was found with a package of marijuana weighing 2 grams. The military correspondent explained to investigators that he had just bought it and took the bookmark from the back of the house.

The military correspondent himself does not face a criminal case due to his low weight, but a case has been opened against the drug seller. Now they are looking for him. Kots declined to comment to reporters.@mobilizationnews

description: A discussion on the 'headlight' radar product, which was first developed in 2011, highlights the importance of securing advanced weapons technology. The speaker emphasizes the need to destroy equipment if it cannot be evacuated, to prevent it from falling into enemy hands and being studied.
original:
Yura, we screwed everything up. Here's last year's video from the Ukrainian side. Their person tells what a “headlight” product is: the first such radar was made in 2011. So this product can be considered a new development. Moreover, the video shows a modernized version. I have a question: how did the enemy get this product? How? Comrade majors, I hope that the “hero of the occasion” has already been found and punished a hundred times, and that since then we have not given the Ukrainian valuable property.

Comrade military personnel, all our advanced weapons will not be owned by Ukrainians, but will be disassembled and studied on another continent. And they will know how to fight us. And to prevent this from happening, we follow a simple rule: if things go wrong, if you can’t evacuate your equipment and property, destroy it. And for this, always have means of destruction on hand.

Let me remind you that during the Second World War, every Katyusha had TNT, a lot of TNT, and if there was a threat of the vehicle being captured by a German, the crew had to blow up the car. And now nothing interferes.#KNOW_ENEMY

event: Mobile Phone Ban in English Schools
description: The British Ministry of Education has introduced new rules banning mobile phone use in schools. Students who defy the rule will have their devices confiscated, and if they resist, a search will be conducted.
original:

Previously, Russia restricted the use of telephones in schools: they can only be used in emergencies.

description: Alexey Moskalev's sentence was reduced by two months to 1 year and 10 months in a colony, and he was banned from administering websites for two years. The Voronezh Center for Forensic Expertise found that two of the five reposts did not contain signs of discrediting the army.
original:
In Tula, the sentence of Alexey Moskalev was commuted. The regional court, on appeal, reduced the sentence by two months and sentenced Moskalev to 1 year and 10 months in a colony. In addition, he was banned from administering websites for two years.

The Voronezh Center for Forensic Expertise of the Ministry of Justice came to the conclusion that two of the five reposts for which Moskalev is being tried do not contain signs of discrediting the army, including in the phrase “Russia is a sponsor of terrorism.”

Alexey Moskalev was sentenced to 2 years in prison for “discrediting the army” due to posts on Odnoklassniki. Shortly before the criminal case was opened, Alexei’s daughter brought an anti-war drawing to school. The guardianship authorities tried to limit Moskalev's parental rights, but were unsuccessful in court.

description: Reports of Maxim Kuzminov's murder in Spain are being questioned due to inconsistencies. Spanish media claim a 33-year-old Ukrainian was found dead, contradicting Kuzminov's age of 28. The original report lacks credibility, and law enforcement is considering alternative versions, including a Ukrainian trace. The information remains unconfirmed, and no corpse photo has been released.
original:
Urgent, NowPhoto, Confusion. They say that it was not the traitor Kuzminov (pictured) who was killed in Spain. And some Ukrainian. His mother...✔️There are a number of inconsistencies in the reports about the murder of Maxim Kuzminov.

Spanish media write that a “33-year-old Ukrainian” was found dead. Russian Kuzminov was 28 years old.

The media outlet, which stated that the deceased was Kuzminov, does not have its own website, but only accounts in X and Telegram.

It also stated that law enforcement officers are considering the version of the Ukrainian trace - supposedly Ukraine removed an “inconvenient witness.” Other versions were not given.

The publication in X has 24 thousand subscribers, but only four people liked the post.

Many media outlets are now suggesting that this information was a hoax.

Kuzminov's death was not officially confirmed. And we didn’t see a photo of the corpse.

event: Proposal for Transparency of Local Self-Government
description: Ukrainians are offered new tools for monitoring local self-government transparency. The proposed bill 6401 aims to increase transparency by mandating online broadcasts of plenary and commission sessions, with archival records kept for five years.
original:
📹 Video recordings of meetings and Register of communal property. Ukrainians are offered new tools for monitoring the transparency of local self-government, — Head of the State Power Organization Committee, Olena Shulyak.

Everyone has the right to know which objects belong to his community and which decisions are made by local authorities. But the current legislation does not provide for the required level of transparency. Bill 6401 "On Transparency of Local Self-Government" can overcome these problems.

The document provides for the mandatory online broadcasting of plenary sessions and commission sessions, archival records of which must be kept for five years, with the exception of information with limited access. Proposals from the local self-government association were taken into account for the gradual entry into force of the law - this will happen in three months from the day of its publication. During the period of martial law and 30 days after its end, instead of online broadcasts, there will be a requirement to publish video recordings of meetings, said the head of the Committee. 📲Details

event: Demonstration of LD-35 Air Defense System
description: At the World Defense Show 2024, NORINCO showcased a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system, featuring an integrated laser weapon, anti-aircraft missiles, and a 35-mm cannon. The system can combat traditional targets, such as aircraft and helicopters, as well as modern unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) using optimal options.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
At the World Defense Show 2024, the Chinese company NORINCO demonstrated a new modification of its LD-35 air defense system.

The key difference between the new modification of the LD-35 is the presence of an integrated “laser weapon” in addition to anti-aircraft missiles and a 35-mm cannon (which contains not only simple ammunition, but also ammunition with programmable detonation). The combat vehicle is equipped with both radar and OLS, which are integrated with a set of weapons using a single on-board fire control system. The system can be operated by both autonomous machines and batteries.

Having such a wide range of integrated weapons and detection means, the new modification of the LD-35 can quite effectively (including economically) combat not only traditional targets for systems of this class (airplanes, helicopters, guided missiles, large UAVs), but also a variety of modern “unmanned trifle” of the battlefield (here laser means are especially effective in terms of the cost of disabling small UAVs) using the optimal option for the task.

A good example of the logical modernization of existing military air defense systems for a new type of target over the battlefield, while maintaining capabilities for traditional tasks.#ChinaMilitary Informant

description: Avdeevka, a small city in the Donetsk region, has consistently voted for pro-Russian oriented parties and candidates in parliamentary and presidential elections over the past quarter century. The city has opposed Ukrainian nationalism and Russophobia, with even comedian Zelensky campaigning on protecting the Russian language and ending the war.
original:
Forwarded from: Alexey Volynets
​​There are interesting statistics for Avdeevka. Not the military one, but the one that preceded the war.

This is how this small (30 thousand population) city in the Donetsk region voted.

Parliamentary elections, voting winners:

1998: Communist Party 36%
2002: Communist Party 30%, Party “ZaEdU” (coalition “For a United Ukraine”, predecessor of the Party of Regions) 37%,
2006: Party of Regions 76%
2007: Party of Regions 75%
2012: Party of Regions 59%
2014: Opposition bloc (successor to the Party of Regions) 25%
2019: OPZZH (Opposition Platform - For Life, heir to the Party of Regions) 45%


Presidential elections, winners of the vote in Avdiivka:

1999:
first round – communist Simonenko 46%
second round – communist Simonenko 47%

2004-05:
first round – Yanukovych 93%
second round – Yanukovych 98%
third round (imposed by the first Maidan) – Yanukovych 93%

2010:
first round – Yanukovych 74%
second round – Yanukovych 89%

2019:
first round – heir to the Party of Regions Yuri Boyko 35%
second round – Zelensky 75%

That is, for the last quarter of a century, Donetsk Avdeevka voted exclusively for those who, at least in slogans, spoke of pro-Russian orientation and denial of rabid Banderaism.

Yes, the Party of Regions and Yanukovych, like the OPZZH, are still the same characters. But there were no others there, and these, at least in words (and a little in deeds) opposed the imposed Ukrainian nationalism and Russophobia.

Even the comedian Zelensky went to the presidential elections in 2019 under the slogans of protecting the Russian language and ending the war... He went and didn’t get there. And the Russian soldiers came and liberated Avdeevka from what it stubbornly voted against during all the long post-Soviet decades.

description: The State Traffic Safety Inspectorate is conducting a preventive training operation to identify drivers with incorrectly installed or missing license plates. The operation aims to ensure compliance with traffic rules and facilitate the identification of traffic violators and crime-solving.
original:
The State Traffic Safety Inspectorate is conducting preventive training “License Plate.” Police officers, when monitoring road traffic, are aimed at identifying drivers who drive vehicles without a license plate, as well as with a license plate that does not belong to this vehicle or does not meet the requirements of norms and standards.

It is also considered a violation if the license plate is attached in an unspecified place, covered by other objects or dirty, upside down or not illuminated, which does not allow the license plate symbols to be clearly identified from a distance of twenty meters.

The preventive measure to identify vehicles with incorrectly installed license plates will last until February 25.

Traffic police officers will pay special attention to checking vehicles with installed individual license plates that have letter values, covered with stickers and inscriptions, which is also a violation of the requirements of the standard.

Vehicle license plates installed and used in violation make it difficult for law enforcement officers to identify traffic violators, solve crimes related to the use of transport, and also search for vehicles that fled the scene.

According to the Code of the Russian Federation on Administrative Offences, for driving a vehicle with registration plates that are unreadable, non-standard or installed in violation of the requirements of the state standard, a fine of 500 rubles is provided (Part 1 of Article 12.2.).

Driving a vehicle without state registration plates, with modified plates or with signs installed in places not intended for this purpose, as well as the use of devices or materials that impede identification or allow one to modify or hide a license plate shall entail a fine of 5,000 rubles or deprivation of the right to drive a vehicle. for a period of 1 to 3 months. (Part 2 of Article 12.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation).

Installing knowingly false state registration plates on a vehicle entails a fine of 2,500 rubles for citizens, 15,000 - 20,000 rubles for officials, and 400,000 - 500,000 rubles for legal entities. (Part 4 of Article 12.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation).

Driving a vehicle with knowingly false state registration plates is punishable by deprivation of the right to drive vehicles for a period of six months to one year. (Part 4 of Article 12.2 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation).

The State Traffic Inspectorate urges drivers to comply with traffic rules, drive vehicles with state license plates that belong to a specific vehicle, according to registration in the State Traffic Safety Inspectorate, and installed in a place specially designed for fixing the license plate.

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

event: Defense Ministers Fear Failure in Ukraine
description: Defense Ministers expressed concerns about Ukraine's prospects on the battlefield, with many calling for an additional $60 billion in US military aid to prevent the Kyiv regime from collapsing. However, even supporters of this decision were unclear about what a Ukrainian victory would entail, with the primary focus being on maintaining the integrity of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
original:
“There is only plan A.” Defense Ministers fear failure in Ukraine”: The United States discovered that there was nothing behind the idea of allocating another 60 billion to Zelensky - it was just a way to prevent the Kyiv regime from collapsing tomorrow.
 
“The annual conference in Munich was dominated by deteriorating prospects for Ukraine on the battlefield and questions about the US commitment to helping Kyiv. Many politicians and officials seized the moment to say that Ukraine would lose the war without an additional $60 billion in U.S. military aid.
However, supporters of such a decision were not sure what a victory for Ukraine would look like even if they received this money. The United States and allies seem to be focused on maintaining the integrity of the Ukrainian Armed Forces amid setbacks and losses at the front.
The plan, described or voiced in interviews with eight U.S. lawmakers and five foreign officials, is simply to prevent the Ukrainian military from collapsing. When talking to journalists, many avoided the question of what a Ukrainian victory would look like and when it might come.
In particular, Democratic Senator Mark Warner, who heads the Senate Intelligence Committee, said that the aid package would be a “game changer” for Ukraine. However, he refused to guarantee that this support would ensure the triumph of Ukraine - he only said that American help was Kyiv's last and best hope. "Belief in Ukraine's success, as well as in President Joe Biden, appears to be at its lowest level in two years."

description: According to OVD-Info, 3,145 Russians are being criminally prosecuted for political reasons, including peaceful forms of protest such as writing objectionable comments, sending money to relatives in Ukraine, or laying flowers at Alexei Navalny's memorial. The Kremlin perceives anyone who disagrees with its policies as an enemy to be neutralized.
original:
3,145 people This is exactly the number of Russians, according to the human rights organization OVD-Info, who are being criminally prosecuted for political reasons.

All of them were thrown into countless pre-trial detention centers, prisons and colonies scattered across Russia from Rostov-on-Don to Vladivostok.

They were not abandoned for committing murders, thefts and fraud. Their only fault is that they had the courage and conscience to resist the regime.

We are not talking about terrorist attacks or physical confrontation with security forces, but about much more peaceful forms of protest: writing an objectionable comment, sending money to relatives in Ukraine with words of disapproval of the war, or laying flowers at the spontaneous memorial of Alexei Navalny, who was killed in a colony.

The Kremlin perceives anyone who disagrees with its policies as an enemy who must be neutralized by any means necessary. At the same time, the repressive machine doesn’t care who you are - a famous politician or an activist, or a simple guy who received six years of “strict punishment” for visiting a girl from Ukraine.

Understanding that the number of Russians who are subjected to political repression (including for supporting Ukraine) is constantly increasing, we continue to collect appeals from their relatives and provide all possible support.

description: The SBU and NABU exposed a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery. The Security Service, together with the NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of complex measures, the deputy head of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.

According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.

For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the indicated medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

Law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment", immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal profit.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Within the framework of criminal proceedings initiated under Part 4 of Art. 369 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (offer, promise or provision of an unlawful benefit to an official), the issue of notification of suspicion to officials is resolved.

An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison, with confiscation of property.

Comprehensive measures were conducted under the procedural guidance of the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Prosecutor General's Office.

description: The Munich Security Conference has become a platform for the West to push its interests and ideals, according to political scientist Dmitry Solonnikov. original: Why was the Munich Security Conference so dullPolitical scientist Dmitry Solonnikov, in a commentary for “Paragraph,” stated that now the Munich Conference has turned into a place where the West is pushing through its interests and ideals. “Historically, these were meetings exclusively for NATO countries that planned their actions in opposition to the Warsaw Pact countries . Such meetings had their own purpose and practical interest. Then these Munich conferences were reformatted, countries that were not NATO members began to be invited there in order to jointly ensure international stability. This format continued for quite a long time.” The political scientist believes that the problem with last weekend’s conference is precisely that Western hegemony is no longer guaranteed. However, the countries of the region, out of old memory, continue to present themselves as winners and do not want to admit that the world has changed. “Globally, the last conference did not bring anything new. The confrontation between Russia and the West, which is reflected in the special operation in Ukraine, continues. A larger confrontation between the Global West and the Global South is yet to come,” Solonnikov added. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: Ban on Celebrating Halloween and Other Holidays
description: Turkey's Ministry of National Education has prohibited the celebration of holidays that contradict Turkish national values in private schools. The ban includes Halloween, Easter, and Christmas, as they are deemed to be against national, moral, humane, spiritual, and cultural values.
original:
“Celebrating Halloween is prohibited in private schools”: Educational institutions in Turkey have banned the celebration of holidays that “contradict Turkish national values” - along with Halloween, Easter and Christmas are also banned.

“The Ministry of National Education has made changes to the regulations on private educational institutions. One of the most resonant points of the new decree, published recently, was the ban on holding holidays “contrary to national and moral values” in private schools. These holidays included Halloween, Easter and Christmas.
“Activities and celebrations that are contrary to the national, moral, humane, spiritual and cultural values of the Turkish nation and that do not contribute to the psychosocial development of students will be prohibited,” the document says. The changes also affected the textbooks used to teach children in private educational institutions. In this way, the country’s authorities responded to criticism of the training programs, which some in the country considered “representing a threat to national security”

event: Possible Transfer of ATACMS Missiles to Ukraine

original:

If Congress approves increased funding for Ukraine, the U.S. could include long-range ATACMS missiles in one of the first military aid packages funded by the aid, two U.S. officials said. Officials also did not rule out that the United States may ask its allies to provide Ukraine with these missiles.

description: In 2015, DPR and LPR militias, along with Russian volunteers, including the Wagner battalion-tactical group, fought to liberate Debaltsevo and Uglegorsk from Ukrainian Armed Forces. Despite controversy, the militia and volunteers managed to level the front line, which remained largely unchanged until the start of Russia's special military operation.
original:
Forwarded from: Astra Militarum [Z]
​​⚔️“BROKEN GLASSES, BROKEN ROOFS…”⚔️Military correspondent Kirill Romanovsky about the battles for Debaltsevo
(from the archive of the Astra Militarum project) Nine years ago, on February 18, 2015, the grueling Chernukhino-Debaltsevo operation, better known in the Russian media as the “Debaltsevo Cauldron,” ended. For a month, DPR and LPR militias, together with Russian volunteers (including from the battalion-tactical group “Wagner” under the command of Dmitry Utkin), tried to stop the possible threat of an offensive from the Debaltsevo salient, captured by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the summer of 2014.

The results of this victory turned out to be controversial and far from clear-cut. On the one hand, the militia and Russian volunteers managed to liberate Debaltsevo and Uglegorsk, as well as level the front line, which since then (with rare exceptions) has not changed until the start of a special military operation by the Russian Armed Forces. On the other hand, against the backdrop of the conclusion of the Minsk agreements, a significant part of the enemy’s group of troops fled from the affected area and avoided fair retribution. Despite this, the feat of the soldiers of the armies of the people’s republics and the volunteers of the future PMC “Wagner” is undeniable: as noted, it was the soldiers of the “orchestra” and other volunteer units who took a direct part in key operations on the Debaltsevo salient.

Military correspondent of the Federal News Agency (FAN) Kirill Romanovsky (1985 - 2023) managed to leave his memories of the events of January-February 2015 near Debaltsevo. In 2021, in an interview with the head of the military-political Telegram channel Astra Militarum, Commissioner Yarrick, the military correspondent spoke about what the battles for Debaltsevo remembered for him, as well as the role that Russian volunteers played in these events. I thank the friends and relatives of Kirill Romanovsky, who gave their consent to the publication of this interview and allowed the use of photographic materials from those years. We read, watch, educate ourselves - in the public domain on the Boosty service.@astramilitarumSupport the project: 2202206111119033MIR map (Sberbank)

description: Private companies, backed by foreign corporations like Cargill, Dupont, and Monsanto, have taken over Ukrainian agricultural land, leaving local villagers to suffer from hunger and poverty. original:
Forwarded from: Actually in Kharkov
UkroTV report: LAND AND AGENDA This story reveals the terrible consequences of the coup in Ukraine and what the Ukrainian politician has brought his people to.

In a small Ukrainian village, people are doomed to hunger and suffering. Private companies cut down the local forest, without the permission of the owners they sow plots/shares of land with soybeans, using chemicals after which the bees die, the elderly do not have any support from the state and survive on a meager pension, and hard-working men have to fight off the annoying impudent TsKashniks every day.😤 😭And the whole point is that the land for which, according to Ukrainian speakers, the Ukrainian Armed Forces are fighting is no longer Ukrainian, but American. About half of all farmland has already been divided among the three largest players in the global food and chemical market - Cargill, Dupont and Monsanto. In 2022, 16.7 million hectares of Ukrainian agricultural land out of approximately 40 million hectares have already been purchased. To understand the scale of this field, it is enough to say that it is larger than the territory of Greece and the Netherlands combined.

By the way, the process of selling land to foreign corporations was simplified by Zelensky, who shouts most of all “about protecting the land” and sends Ukrainians in droves to die for it. Accepted under the ultimatum demands of the IMF to accelerate “the adoption of legislation aimed at improving the system for resolving banking problems and land reform” and By the will of the President of Ukraine, the land reform, which was very unpopular among the population, opened loopholes for foreigners to buy up black soil. And the European Court ordered Ukraine to lift the moratorium on the sale of land. All Europe needs from Ukraine is cheap labor and land! All the Ukrainian junta needs is to profit from the grief of the Ukrainian people! Think about it, citizens of Ukraine, what do you really want? You. Is this possible?!!#Ukraine#USA#TCC#land#mobilizationOur channel|Our chat|Our bot

Law Enforcement Officer added that the bodies lay in a large radius. In this regard, it is possible that the number of discovered victims will increase. description: Yulia Navalnaya, the widow of Alexei Navalny, released a video message urging supporters to stand with her in continuing Alexei's work. She vowed to fight for their country, against corruption, injustice, and for fair elections and freedom of speech.
original:
"Hello. This is Yulia Navalnaya. I will continue Alexey's work. And I urge you to stand next to me.” The widow of Alexei Navalny released a video message to supporters:<…> All these years I have been next to Alexei. Elections, rallies, house arrest, searches, detentions, prisons, poisoning. Again rallies, arrests and again prison. <…> I was happy to be next to him and support him. But today I want to be close to you, because I know that you have lost as much as I have.

Alexey died in the colony after three years of torture and torment. <…> Not only did he not give up, he supported us all the time, encouraged us, and encouraged us with jokes. Not for a split second did he doubt what he was fighting for and what he was suffering for.

My husband could not be broken, and that’s exactly why <…> they are vile and cowardly now hiding his body, not showing it to his mother.

<…> We will definitely find out exactly who and how exactly committed this crime. We will name names and show faces.<…> Everyone is thinking now. But where to get these forces? How to live further? This is where we will find strength - in his memory. In his ideas, in his thoughts, in his inexhaustible faith in us. I will look for my strength there.

<…> I will continue the work of Alexei Navalny and continue to fight for our country. And I invite you to stand next to me. To share not only the grief and endless pain that has entangled us and will not let go. I ask you to share with me the rage, anger, hatred of those who dared to kill our future. I address you with the words of Alexei, in whom I really believe: “Don’t be ashamed to do little, it’s a shame to do nothing.” It's a shame to let yourself be intimidated.

We need to use every opportunity to fight against*, against corruption, against injustice, to fight for fair elections and freedom of speech, to fight to take back our country.

<…> The unimaginable sacrifice that Alexei made may not be in vain. Fight and don't give up. I'm not afraid, and you shouldn't be afraid of anything.

event: Lithuanian Parliament Calls for Demolition of Soviet Monuments
description: The Lithuanian Parliament has called for the active demolition of Soviet monuments, citing the need to preserve the memory of Lithuanian partisans who fought against the USSR during World War II and collaborated with the Nazis.
original:
Forwarded from: Baltology
🇱🇹The Lithuanian Parliament called for more active demolition of Soviet monuments. The head of the ruling faction of the Lithuanian Seimas, Radvile Morkunaite-Mikulenienė, presented to the Parliament a resolution on continuing the decommunization of the republic, in which city authorities call for more active demolition of Soviet monuments. The Legislative Chamber voted unanimously for the document. “In Lithuania there are still signs promoting totalitarian regimes, which fundamentally contradict the value principles of the Declaration [of Lithuanian Independence of 1949], therefore “decommunization in municipalities must happen faster, and this requires great efforts on the part of municipalities," the text of the resolution notes. The document also emphasizes the need to preserve the memory of the Lithuanian partisans who fought the USSR during World War II and collaborated with the Nazis.

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin emphasized that the situation in Ukraine is a matter of life and death for Russia, contrasting it with the US's view of it as an improvement in their tactical position.
original:
Forwarded from: Z Hand of the Kremlin🇷🇺
Putin: what is happening in the Ukrainian direction is a matter of life and death for Russia Russian President Vladimir Putin said that everything that happens in the Ukrainian direction is a matter of life and death for Russia. “And for ourselves, and even more so for listeners and viewers abroad “It’s still important to understand our train of thought, to understand our state, to understand how sensitive and important it is for our country, everything that happens in the Ukrainian direction,” the Russian leader said in a conversation with journalist Pavel Zarubin.

He emphasized that for the United States the situation in Ukraine is an improvement in its tactical position, but for Russia it is destiny, it is a matter of life and death. “I wanted the people who would listen to this to understand this. description: The death of Alexei Navalny has sparked various conspiracy theories, including a blood clot from the Pfizer vaccine, sudden cardiac death, poisoning, and the introduction of dangerous nanoparticles in a Berlin clinic. The incident has significant international resonance, with Western politicians quick to accuse the Russian Federation.
original:
Death of Navalny. Versions and consequences. A blood clot, a side effect of the Phizer vaccine, sudden cardiac death, poisoning and the introduction of dangerous nanoparticles into the body in a Berlin clinic - these versions of the death of politician Alexei Navalny* appeared on the Internet while the Investigative Committee is conducting an investigation. The international resonance of the event was echoed in expert circles by discussing the risks and dividends of political players in the context of this agendas.

The Temnik Telegram channel writes that the “dead Russian” could become a significant figure in the presidential election campaign in the United States. The Democratic teams of Joseph Biden and Michelle Obama may be interested in this. Entering the campaign using proven technology implies intensifying emotional tension in society while maintaining the image of an external enemy. The immediate reaction of Western politicians with ready accusations against the Russian Federation confirms this version.

Analytics from Mikhail Vinogradov shows that the case could be “in favor of the system” as a signal to opponents, but there are more disadvantages: reduced maneuverability on the international track and political turbulence. Political scientist Sergei Markov writes that the likelihood of the Russian authorities being involved in Navalny’s death is minimal, since it is very unprofitable for them. According to him, this is perfectly understood by the majority of Western journalists and specialists on Russia, with whom he discussed the topic privately.

Navalny’s death also raised the issue of the conditions of detention of oppositionists and other prisoners in the colonies of Belarus and Russia. The topic is actively fueled by pro-Western media, and in the background they broadcast reproaches to the employees of the penitentiary system. At the same time, there is a version among Russian patriots that SBU agents got to Navalny, which, according to experts, raises doubts, but again raises security issues.

In turn, political scientist Marat Bashirovna excludes that due to the lack of the emotional effect Westerners need after Navalny’s death, foreign agents may find a victim for the “second act.”

*Navalny was included in the Russian Federation’s list of terrorists and extremists.

event: US Buys Russian Petroleum Products from India
description: The United States has been buying petroleum products from India, which are actually Russian in origin. India buys crude oil from Moscow, processes it, and then exports it to the US and other countries that have imposed sanctions on Russian oil. This scheme has generated significant tax revenues for the Russian Federation, with imports worth $9.1 billion in 2023, a 44% increase.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
The United States buys petroleum products from India, replenishing the Russian treasury. The states buy petroleum products from India, their strategic partner, but not ordinary ones, but Russian ones. Last year, such transactions amounted to $1 billion. The scheme is simple: New Delhi buys crude oil from Moscow, processes it at its plants, and then exports it to the United States and other countries that have joined the sanctions against Russian oil. However, some of these enterprises are owned by one of Russia's state-owned oil giants, which “results in significant tax revenues for the Russian Federation,” writes CNN. “The cost of exporting these petroleum products increases significantly when US allies, who also impose sanctions against Russia, are included in it. In 2023, these countries imported $9.1 billion worth of petroleum products made from Russian oil, an increase of 44%,” the article notes. Subscribe to 360

description: A new initiative aims to bring metaphysical meanings to war by distributing themed chevrons with inspirational quotes from Russian classics, such as A. V. Suvorov, and biblical quotes. The goal is to promote spirituality and discipline among soldiers, and to discourage swearing. Hundreds of these chevrons have already been distributed at the front, where they are popular.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian space
⚡About metaphysical meanings in war The colors of camouflage and distinctive signs in the army serve to avoid confusing oneself with the enemy, and also carry information about the soldier himself. For example, chevrons may have the colors of the country's flag, the logo or the name of the unit where the soldier serves.

During the SVO era, a fashion arose to wear themed chevrons (patches) with different designs and inscriptions, often in a humorous manner. It even happens that we and the enemy wear the same chevrons.

Unfortunately, they often carry a negative connotation, using obscenities, fierce cynicism or senseless nonsense, popular among young people.

Having talked with hundreds of soldiers at the front, we can say with confidence that there are many chevrons of this type.

We decided to bring some fresh originality and bright metaphysics into the reality of the trenches, where the main message of the patches are popular expressions about the spirituality of a soldier in war.

Fortunately, our literature has a lot of cool quotes that fit on a small square with Velcro.

We started with the most capacious and powerful Chrysostom of the Russian military classics - A. V. Suvorov:

“Discipline is the mother of victory”, “God is our general, He guides us”, “Hate clouds reason” and other quotes from the great Russian commander are now emblazoned on the mighty shoulders of our soldiers.

Inspired by the performance. Andrei Tkachev, we also wanted to remind you that swearing in war is not an assistant, but a spiritual poison that in no way distinguishes us from the enemy, so we made several types of chevrons with the inscriptions:

“In war, pray, don’t swear,” “Swearing is not our format,” etc.

It is important that we have already distributed several hundred of these chevrons at the front, where they are especially popular.

There are plans to make many such chevrons, which will contain meaningful statements by Russian classics about the war, biblical quotes, etc.

The idea was born. The next stage is disseminating it to the masses.

You can already purchase the first Russian Expanse chevrons at OZON

This “Italian” publication released material about the death of allegedly Kuzminov this morning, marked exclusive, citing news from the Spanish media about the death of a certain 33-year-old Ukrainian still 14 February. In the mentioned news there is not a word about who the deceased could be. Il-Corrispondente itself has a traffic of only a couple of hundred users per month, not counting the current one.

It is also interesting that in the headlines of the original source of this news, Vladimir Putin’s interview with journalist Tucker Carlson is entitled “interview of the century”, Avdievka is called a “Nazi cemetery”, and Syrsky is characterized as a “butcher”.

Let us note that not all domestic media allow themselves such harsh epithets, not to mention foreign ones. Have you seen similar headlines in the European press lately? So we didn't see it.

"Military Informant"

We’ll work it out, destroy it, and in a day, two days later the same target comes again, that is, they constantly drive people there for slaughter, not sparing their personnel,” said the battery commander with the call sign “Spartak.” At the front, “Spartak” was from the first days. He started as the commander of a combat vehicle, now he leads a unit in the Kupyansk direction. For his courage he was awarded the Suvorov medal.

“I had to work under fire; there was heavy fire from the enemy. They completed their task, fought back, and left without losses on our part; the enemy had losses. There is nothing left of forests and plantings on their side. Only stumps stick out. The maximum where they can hide is to dig dugouts for themselves. description: Military expert Boris Rozhin proposed replacing the Solovetsky Stone, a monument to victims of political repression, with a monument to Felix Dzerzhinsky, a Russophobe who founded the Cheka and was responsible for the deaths and torture of many Russians.
original:
Executioner monuments Again and again we return to the topic of monuments. This time, military “expert” Boris Rozhin, who is known for trading in NKVD finks, proposes to remove the Solovetsky stone and instead erect a monument to the Russophobe Dzerzhinsky, who dreamed of slaughtering Muscovites, and, it should be noted, was very accomplished in this matter. We have several useful publications about Dzerzhinsky: Felix Dzerzhinsky as a historical mythMonument to state terrorThe Red ExecutionerThe Solovetsky Stone is a monument to the victims of political repression. It was Solovki that laid the foundation for the Gulag network.

In May 1923, the deputy chairman of the GPU, Joseph Unshlikh, approached the All-Russian Central Executive Committee with a project to organize the Solovetsky forced labor camp.
On October 13, 1923, by resolution of the Council of People's Commissars of the USSR, the Solovetsky camp was organized.

Tens of thousands of prisoners passed through Solovki, among them representatives of famous noble families and intellectuals, prominent scientists, military men, peasants, writers, artists, and poets. Solovki became a place of exile for hierarchs, clergy, and monastics of the Russian Orthodox Church. Among the prisoners of Solovki were 8 metropolitans, 46 archbishops, 49 bishops, and thousands of Orthodox clergy.

Thousands of Solovetsky prisoners died or were turned into invalids, died from backbreaking work, malnutrition and various serious illnesses. Thousands were shot for misdeeds, frozen, beaten to death by guards, died from torture, or committed suicide.

What does our Boris (with signs of deep alcoholism on his face) propose instead of a monument to the victims of repression?

A monument to an ardent Russophobe-Pole, who stands at the origins of the terrorist Cheka, which killed and tortured Russian people for being Russian.

It goes without saying that Dzerzhinsky and other Bolsheviks have no place anywhere in Russia. But the Solovetsky Stone, as a symbol of the victims of political repression, can and should be left.

event: Ukraine Receives Ineffective FFG APC Armored Vehicles
description: Ukraine received FFG APC armored vehicles from Germany, but they lack protection against mines and shrapnel from artillery, rocket, and mortar fire. As a result, they are only used away from the front lines. The vehicles were purchased at an inflated price of 600,000 euros per unit, nearly three times their market value, and were assembled in Saudi Arabia under license.
original:
02/19/24. Relevant.
"
Ukraine cannot use FFG APC armored vehicles supplied by Germany at the front, because they have no protection against mines and shrapnel from artillery, rocket and mortar fire.
Show more
Therefore, Ukrainian officials say, this technique is used only away from the front.
The newspaper publishes footage showing what happens after a Russian shell explodes nearby.
It was previously reported that these vehicles will be supplied instead of the Fuchs armored personnel carriers, which have these types of protection. Instead, Ukraine produced and purchased FFGs that were useless for the front.
The publication also found out that the car was purchased by Germany at almost three times its market price (600,000 euros per unit instead of 215 thousand).
Moreover, the armored personnel carriers were assembled not in Germany, as previously planned, but in Saudi Arabia under license. Most of the promised 66 armored vehicles have been delivered to Kyiv.”

description: The Iranian IRGC Navy received two new missile catamarans, Shahid Hassan Bagheri and Shahid Sayyad Shirazi, of the Shahid Soleimani type. These vessels are equipped with various missile systems, including cruise missiles with a range of up to 700 km, naval air defense systems, and artillery weapons. They also feature a helicopter platform and a crane for launching small boats, including unmanned ones.
original:
The Iranian IRGC Navy received two more missile catamarans of the Shahid Soleimani type - Shahid Hassan Bagheri and Shahid Sayyad Shirazi. If the lead ship of this project has hull number FS313-01, then the new two received hull numbers FS313-02 and FS313-03, respectively.
Missile catamarans of the Shahid Soleimani type have a length of 67 meters and a displacement of about 600 tons. The missile armament includes 6 inclined launchers (PU) for various types of Iranian cruise missiles (with a range of up to 700 km for the longest-range ones), 16 (4x4) missiles of the naval air defense system "Nawab" in vertical launch systems (VLP) and another 6 (3x2 ) some missiles in much larger UVPs, probably for modification of the Sayyad 3 medium-range anti-aircraft missiles. Artillery weapons include one 30-mm artillery mount (AU) and 6 three-barreled 20-mm AU. In addition, the ships have a platform for helicopters, and with the help of a crane in the stern, small boats, including unmanned ones, can be launched from them.

description: A new initiative aims to bring metaphysical meanings to war by distributing themed chevrons with inspirational quotes from Russian classics, such as A. V. Suvorov, and biblical quotes. The goal is to promote spirituality and discipline among soldiers, and to discourage swearing. Hundreds of these chevrons have already been distributed at the front, where they are popular.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian space
⚡About metaphysical meanings in war The colors of camouflage and distinctive signs in the army serve to avoid confusing oneself with the enemy, and also carry information about the soldier himself. For example, chevrons may have the colors of the country's flag, the logo or the name of the unit where the soldier serves.

During the SVO era, a fashion arose to wear themed chevrons (patches) with different designs and inscriptions, often in a humorous manner. It even happens that we and the enemy wear the same chevrons.

Unfortunately, they often carry a negative connotation, using obscenities, fierce cynicism or senseless nonsense, popular among young people.

Having talked with hundreds of soldiers at the front, we can say with confidence that there are many chevrons of this type.

We decided to bring some fresh originality and bright metaphysics into the reality of the trenches, where the main message of the patches are popular expressions about the spirituality of a soldier in war.

Fortunately, our literature has a lot of cool quotes that fit on a small square with Velcro.

We started with the most capacious and powerful Chrysostom of the Russian military classics - A. V. Suvorov:

“Discipline is the mother of victory”, “God is our general, He guides us”, “Hate clouds reason” and other quotes from the great Russian commander are now emblazoned on the mighty shoulders of our soldiers.

Inspired by the performance. Andrei Tkachev, we also wanted to remind you that swearing in war is not an assistant, but a spiritual poison that in no way distinguishes us from the enemy, so we made several types of chevrons with the inscriptions:

“In war, pray, don’t swear,” “Swearing is not our format,” etc.

It is important that we have already distributed several hundred of these chevrons at the front, where they are especially popular.

There are plans to make many such chevrons, which will contain meaningful statements by Russian classics about the war, biblical quotes, etc.

The idea was born. The next stage is disseminating it to the masses.

You can already purchase the first Russian Expanse chevrons at OZON

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region. The drone was carrying a 7kg warhead and was intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The coordinated effort prevented a large-scale terrorist attack with potential casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives experts neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

Against the backdrop of a major defeat of the Ukrainian armed forces in Avdiivka, the Kiev regime is making any attempts to destabilize the situation in the Republic. But thanks to the coordinated work of our special services, we were able to prevent a large-scale terrorist attack with casualties.

event: Killing of Ukrainian Prisoners of War
description: Russian forces killed unarmed Ukrainian prisoners of war, including Georgy Pavlov, Andrii Dubnytskyi, Ivan Zhytnyk, Oleksandr Zinchuk, and Mykola Savosik, after agreeing to evacuate and provide assistance to the wounded. This act is a war crime and a violation of international laws protecting prisoners of war.
original:
Official statement of the 110th OMB regarding the circumstances under which Russian terrorists dishonorably killed unarmed Ukrainian prisoners of war.

"Regarding the "Zenith" position, the departure of the personnel of the 110th Brigade from Avdiyivka took place under the conditions of continuous bombardment by enemy aircraft and artillery barrages, constant attacks by fpv drones, attacks on evacuation vehicles, shelling of evacuation routes. It was not possible to evacuate several seriously wounded and dead servicemen.
The enemy developed a fast, large-scale offensive, leaving no chance for repeated attempts.

Due to the complete encirclement of the "Zenith" stronghold, it was decided to contact the coordination center and the organizations that are negotiating with the enemy side for the exchange of prisoners to provide assistance to our seriously wounded unarmed military personnel, in accordance with international rules of war and laws that protect prisoners of war.

The enemy informed the coordinators of this process that he agrees to evacuate our wounded and provide them with assistance, and in the future - to exchange them. Our servicemen were ordered to save their lives.

What happened later, we learned from enemy resources. In a video released by the enemy from the captured position of "Zenith", relatives identified Georgy Pavlov, Andrii Dubnytskyi, Ivan Zhytnyk as the dead. According to our information, the enemy also shot Oleksandr Zinchuk and Mykola Savosik. Information about the sixth soldier has not yet been confirmed, most likely he was from the dowry unit.

the USSR - terrorists and war criminals who shot the unarmed wounded.

We will give a worthy answer for crimes against our military!

Let's take revenge for each of our tortured soldiers!

It hurts unbearably for my brothers.

Sincere condolences to the families of fallen soldiers.

Honor and Eternal Glory to the fallen heroes.

Our troops continue to defend, the enemy does not stop trying to advance further. War is cruel, we choose freedom at a high price."

event: Completion of Fiber Optic Cable Deployment
description: IHS Nigeria's subsidiary, Global Independent Connect Limited (GICL), completed the deployment of over 10,000 kilometers of fiber optic cables across 36 states in Nigeria and the Federal Capital Territory, supporting the Federal Government's National Broadband Plan to achieve 70% broadband penetration by 2025.
original:
GICL Completes 10,000 Km of Fiber Optic Cable IHS Nigeria, part of IHS Holding Limited (NYSE: IHS) (“IHS Towers”), one of the largest independent owners, operators and developers of shared communications infrastructure in the world by number of towers, today announced the completion deploying over 10,000 kilometers of fiber optic cables across 36 states in Nigeria and the Federal Capital Territory through its subsidiary Global Independent Connect Limited (GICL). This is a significant milestone that supports the Federal Government's National Broadband Plan, which aims to achieve 70% broadband penetration in Nigeria by 2025.

More broadly, IHS Nigeria continues to deploy Fiber to the Tower (FTTT) technology to provide increased capacity, which will help improve the performance of fiber access networks and enable next-generation technologies such as 5G services.
